markdownRemark.html:
Score: 100

sun-sentinel.com  (WEB - en-US)

The website of the South Florida Sun Sentinel, a Fort Lauderdale-based daily newspaper.

This website generally maintains basic standards of credibility and transparency.
Does not repeatedly publish false content
Gathers and presents information responsibly
Regularly corrects or clarifies errors
Handles the difference between news and opinion responsibly
Avoids deceptive headlines
Website discloses ownership and financing
Clearly labels advertising
Reveals who's in charge, including any possible conflicts of interest
The site provides names of content creators, along with either contact or biographical information

Ownership and Financing

The Sun Sentinel is owned by Tribune Publishing Company, a publicly traded, Chicago-based media and publishing company formerly known as Tronc Inc. Tribune’s holdings include The Baltimore Sun, Hartford Courant, New York Daily News, Orlando Sentinel, and the flagship Chicago Tribune.

Tribune generates its revenue through advertising and subscriptions for its printed and digital products.

Content

The site features original coverage of local news, as well as state, national, and international coverage primarily from The Associated Press. Some Florida news coverage comes from other state newspapers and news sites, including the Orlando Sentinel bureau in the state capital of Tallahassee.

Credibility

Howard Saltz, publisher and editor in chief of the Sun Sentinel from March 2016 to February 2018, was criticized in 2016 Politico report for displaying “a pattern of censoring controversial stories,” including one involving an elected official allegedly discussing bribes. After news broke about the official discussing favors in return for his support of a development project, the Sun Sentinel published a story but quickly pulled it from the site at Saltz’s behest, according to staffers who spoke with Politico. The Sun Sentinel did eventually cover the allegations against Hallandale Beach Vice Mayor Bill Julian. Julian was later investigated by the Broward State Attorney’s Office, which found no evidence of wrongdoing.

The Sun Sentinel lists clarifications and corrections, and also provides an email address and phone number for readers to report errors on the same webpage. The Sun Sentinel won its first Pulitzer Prize for an investigation into off-duty police officers speeding. It has been a Pulitzer finalist thirteen times. It endorsed Barack Obama for president in 2008, Mitt Romney in 2012, and Hillary Clinton in 2016.

Transparency

The site provides email addresses and phone numbers for all editors on its Newsroom Directory page. The Sun Sentinel publishes the names of the members of its editorial board and links staff reporters’ profiles, which include email addresses (and social media profiles, if applicable), in their bylines. Following an inquiry from NewsGuard, the site’s Contact Us page discloses its ownership by Tribune.

The site clearly labels all advertising.

History

Founded in 1911 as the Everglades Breeze, the Sun Sentinel was purchased by the Tribune Company in 1963. 

Written by:
Nina Zweig

Edited by:
Anna-Sophie Harling Jim Warren
